summary: PHP SDK should accept null for CA certificate in SSL client creation, matching gRPC's behavior. Most production servers don't need CA override as they use system-level CAs or known CAs.
userImpact: Users running against production servers with standard CAs are forced to provide unnecessary CA certificate parameters, complicating client configuration.
rootCause: PHP SDK requires CA certificate in createSSL while most production use cases don't need to override the default system CA.
proposedFix: Accept null for CA certificate parameter in createSSL, similar to gRPC's channel credentials implementation.
resolutionDetails: Issue closed due to inactivity by maintainers after multiple requests for clarification went unanswered.
keyQuote: Most production servers, including our cloud, don't need to override the CA as its either signed by a known CA or they install the CA root at the system level.
